GoalDescription: An economy which fosters sustainable growth and development through low impact industries and modern technologies to ensure the well-being of future generations
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Ensure new infrastructure development activities cause minimal disturbance to the natural land and marine environment
IndicatorDescription: Number of development projects complying with EIA requirements
ComputationMethod: Number of development projects complying with EIA requirements
Concept: EIA is a proactive panning and decision –making tool that has an important role to play in identifying impacts, assessing ricks and evaluating the costs and benefits of development projects before they are implemented
DataSource: Deparment of Environment Protection and Conservation, VIPA
Definition: EIA is defined as Environmental Impact Assessment; it is the process for identifying and managing the impacts of a project on the natural, social and custom environment.
Dissaggregation:
* types of projects
* Area Council Level
* Provincial Level
* National Level
IndicatorShortName: Projects in Compliance with EIA Requirements
Rationale: Number of steps in EIA varies bases on the potential impacts of the project. While the number of steps in the process may vary, the process will always start with the project proponent submitting an application for an environmental permit and will always end with the Department of Environmental protection and Conservation’s (the Department) decision to grant or refuse an environment permit under the EPC Act.
TargetDescription: By 2030 - 50% of development projects are complying with EIA  requirements
